newsitem.title: NORWAY: Norsk Hydro's net profits slump in Q3.
newsitem.headline: Norsk Hydro's net profits slump in Q3.

text.p: Diversified industrial giant Norsk Hydro ASA said on Monday lower prices for aluminium and petrochemicals were mainly responsible for a 45 percent slump in net profits in the third quarter compared with a year ago.
Norway's largest listed company booked profits after tax of 909 million crowns ($139 million) for the three-month period against 1.66 billion crowns in the same 1995 period.
Hydro said its tax provisions were also higher in the quarter due to increased earnings from offshore oil and gas activities.

Third-quarter operating income of 2.15 billion crowns was 21 percent down from 2.72 billion and included a writedown of 400 million crowns because of a downward revision of estimates for remaining oil and gas reserves in the Frigg area of the North Sea.

"The decline was due to significantly lower earnings for light metals and petrochemicals," a statement from the company said. "Oil and gas showed a marked improvement in operating income, while results for agriculture showed a moderate reduction compared to the previous year."
